title: Week in pictures: 11-17 July 2020
description: A selection of powerful news photographs taken around the world this week.

title: Social media influencers warned against promoting fake brands
description: Trading Standards and police are warning social media influencers against promoting fake brands.

title: Rockfield Studios: Where Ozzy, Oasis, Queen and Coldplay took off
description: The studio on the Welsh-English border which has been the hangout for rock royalty for 60 years.

title: Coronavirus: More than 140 released prisoners housed in hotels during lockdown
description: Hotels are used only "as a last resort" to reduce the spread of coronavirus, the government says.

title: Unflustered news anchor loses tooth live on air
description: Marichka Padalko simply put the tooth in her hand and continued presenting the news.

title: Coronavirus: US v other countries... did it mess up its reopening?
description: By the time most Americans emerged from lockdown restrictions, a second surge was already under way.

title: Capt Sir Tom Moore knighted: War veteran vows to keep Queen conversation private
description: The 100-year-old is knighted in a socially distanced ceremony - thought to be the first of its kind.

title: My Money: 'My house looks happy'
description: Anna Josse Eklund from Sweden takes us through her week during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan: Indian actress taken to hospital with Covid-19
description: The Indian actress and her daughter had been isolating since testing positive earlier this week.

title: Officer suspended over 'kneeling on neck' during arrest
description: A deputy commissioner calls footage of the arrest in Islington "extremely disturbing".

title: Bowling alleys and casinos to reopen - what will they look like?
description: Bowling shoes could become a thing of the past says one firm, as it prepares to reopen in August.

title: Coronavirus: Boris Johnson statement fact-checked
description: Reality Check examines five claims made by Prime Minister Boris Johnson and Lady Harding.

title: Latitude: Why a cancelled music festival leaves a 'big void'
description: Haim, Liam Gallagher and The Chemical Brothers were due to play at Latitude this weekend.

title: Princess Beatrice marries Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi in private Windsor ceremony
description: Her marriage to Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi took place in Windsor and was attended by the Queen.

title: Coronavirus: Boris Johnson sets out plan for 'significant normality' by Christmas
description: Boris Johnson says employers will have more discretion to bring staff back to workplaces in England.

title: Knife crime in England and Wales at record high, figures show
description: It has risen 6% compared with the previous year, but overall offending has fallen, figures suggest.

title: British Airways retires entire 747 fleet after travel downturn
description: British Airways is permanently grounding its jumbo jets which are nicknamed "the queen of the skies".

title: Fans could return to stadiums in October, says Prime Minister
description: Fans could be able to watch sport inside stadiums in England again from October, says Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

title: Protests after Detroit teen detained over missed homework
description: Michigan's supreme court says it will review the original family court ruling against 'Grace'.

title: Boy, 10, dies after accident at works site in Glasgow
description: Emergency services were called to the construction site in Glasgow on Thursday evening.

title: Cadbury accused of 'shrinkflation' as packs get smaller
description: Owner Mondelez says the move will fight obesity, but the firm faces accusations of "shrinkflation".

title: Hancock calls for urgent review into coronavirus death data in England
description: Deaths recorded in England may have included people who tested positive months before they died.

title: Why Monty Python's Life of Brian, once rated X, is now a 12A
description: The BBFC's reclassification means the comedy has had four different ratings since its 1979 release.

title: Council 'failed' London twins facing deportation to different countries
description: Darren Roberts' partner claims Ealing Council has not helped sort out the twins' immigration papers.

title: Sergei Furgal: The arrest fuelling anti-Moscow anger in Russia's far east
description: Thousands have been rallying in Khabarovsk to demand their governor be returned for a fair trial.

title: PDAs and an 'unbelievable' interview - London 2012 things you may have forgotten
description: The Kenny kiss, going mad for Mo Farah and Bert le Clos' 'beautiful boy' - 10 moments you might have forgotten from the London 2012 Olympics.

title: The Papers: Russian hackers and the 'jihadi bride' returns
description: UK accusations that Russian hackers have targeted Covid-19 vaccine research dominate the front pages.

title: Hospital wedding for terminally ill patient
description: When Tash Young was given weeks to live, she was determined to marry her boyfriend before she died.

title: New South Wales erosion: Huge swells leave homes at risk of collapse
description: Huge waves have lashed the New South Wales coastline this week, causing erosion beneath homes.

title: Doctor Room: The counsellor helping digital sex crime victims
description: "I felt that taking a break is a sin," she says. "If I sleep it means more videos get out there."
